name: Dominica
description: The Nature Island, Dominica, is a volcanic island nation in the Caribbean Sea, renowned for its dramatic landscapes, lush rainforests, and commitment to ecotourism.  It’s significantly less developed than many of its Caribbean neighbors, preserving a pristine environment and offering a unique, immersive experience for visitors. Dominica boasts a rich cultural heritage, a vibrant Creole community, and a strong focus on sustainability.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city of Dominica.
quickFacts.detail: Roseau is a bustling port town with colorful buildings, local markets, and a historic waterfront.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Dominica's population is primarily of African descent.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in rural areas, deeply connected to the land and its resources.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language of Dominica.
quickFacts.detail: Kweyol (Creole) is widely spoken and understood throughout the island.

quickFacts.label: GDP per capita
quickFacts.description: Dominica has a relatively low GDP per capita.
quickFacts.detail: The economy relies heavily on tourism, agriculture, and small-scale industries.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Dominica is a relatively small island.
quickFacts.detail: It’s the second-lethalest island in the Caribbean.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: Dominica experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by consistently high temperatures and rainfall throughout the year.  The island benefits from a moist trade wind, contributing to its lush vegetation and frequent showers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and humid, with frequent showers and occasional thunderstorms.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a gradual decrease in rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures.  It’s a beautiful time for hiking and exploring.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the driest season, with the most sunshine and the lowest rainfall. Temperatures are mild and comfortable.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a return to wetter conditions, with increasing rainfall and blossoming flora.

naturalWonders.name: Boiling Lake
naturalWonders.description: Boiling Lake is the world’s second-largest hot lake, formed by volcanic activity. It’s a challenging but rewarding hike to reach this geothermal marvel.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake’s surface temperature reaches an astonishing 194°C (381°F). The surrounding rainforest is unique due to the mineral-rich steam vents.

naturalWonders.name: Trafalgar Falls
naturalWonders.description: Trafalgar Falls are a pair of stunning waterfalls cascading down moss-covered cliffs into a refreshing pool.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Upper Falls plunge 60 meters (197 feet), while the Lower Falls cascade 30 meters (98 feet). The surrounding rainforest is teeming with wildlife.
viewingTips: Take a dip in the pool at the base of the Lower Falls.

naturalWonders.name: Morne Trois Pitons National Park
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Morne Trois Pitons National Park is a haven for biodiversity and dramatic volcanic landscapes.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park contains Boiling Lake, Trafalgar Falls, and numerous other unique geological formations and plant species. It’s a crucial area for conservation.
viewingTips: Book a guided tour to learn about the park's history and ecology.

biodiversityCategory.name: Rainforest Ecosystem
biodiversityCategory.description: Dominica’s rainforests are incredibly diverse, supporting a vast array of plant and animal life.

statistics.details: Including many endemic species found nowhere else on Earth.
Dominica is a birdwatcher’s paradise, home to numerous endemic and migratory species.

notableSpecies.name: Sisserou Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: The national bird of Dominica, critically endangered due to habitat loss and hunting.

notableSpecies.name: Dominica White-eye
notableSpecies.significance: A small, vibrant bird found only on Dominica.

ecosystemData.title: Dominica’s Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Dominica’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from its lush rainforests to its rugged volcanic landscapes and coral reefs.  The island’s commitment to ecotourism and conservation is vital for preserving this natural heritage.
